result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter B. Boris

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Motion hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond. Filed by Atty Bergner.

4:10 PM Defendant Peter B. Boris appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Peter B. Boris.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22TR2308 is tracking with 22CF411.

Court calls the case.
ADA Mutchler states the appearances.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.

4:12 p.m.  Exhibit #P1, copy of criminal complaint, is marked for ADA Mutchler.

4:13 p.m.  Deputy Z Marquard is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Mutchler.
4:20 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
ADA Mutchler would ask that the record reflect the witness identified the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
The record so reflects the identification.
4:21 p.m   ADA Mutchler references exhibit #P1.
PBT .09
ADA Mutchler would move exhibit #P1 into evidence subject to cross examination.  Atty Bergner objects and states the statute on the record and his reasons for the objection.
ADA Mutchler responds.
Exhibit #P1 is received minus the line with regards to the mention of the PBT results.
4:24 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Bergner.
No redirect by ADA Mutchler.
Witness is excused.
ADA Mutchler has no additional witnesses.
Atty Bergner does not have any witnesses.
ADA Mutchler would ask that the court find probable cause.
Atty Bergner does not have any final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Not guilty plea is entered on behalf of the defendant on 22TR2308.
22TR2308 will continue to track with 22CF411.
Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:28 PM Defendant Peter B. Boris appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Peter B. Boris.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 09/06/22 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 2

Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
Participate in the Portage County Justice Programs and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting, once he is released.

1:10 PM Defendant Peter B Boris appeared by video.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.   

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.
Court has reviewed the probable cause statement.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 5th or 6th Offense and Operating While Revoked & 2 additional possible charges as stated on the record. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $3,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 
Atty Soule would request a lower cash bond and states her reasons on the record.
Defendant is currently on a PO hold.

BY THE COURT: 
Court will set a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
